comments.text:
I only waited 5 minutes by standing near the toll station where the cars slow down. It took me just 5 minutes to find a ride to Melaka.

If hitchhiking there feels too risky, you could try walking along the bike path on the left to reach the gas station behind the toll.

There is a big toll gate south of the city which is an excellent hitchhiking place, but not too easy to reach.

You can easily find a direct lift to Singapore.
R&R's are perfect hitchspots. The first person I asked brought me to Ipoh
The cars exiting here are not going to Ipoh, they remain in Penang, thus in order to find a ride over the bridge you must wait further back by the pedestrian bridge and the bus stop.

Take a bus from Georgetown and come up here! I get fast ride to Ipoh! :) 

July 2015
Cheers! //Yriy

It is an industrial area near the airport so, this bridge is mainly used by trucks and cars that come from the airport.

The road is relatively new so the traffic flow is not that much. But you can easily stop a car.

If you come from the airport it is about 15 to 20 min walking. If you come from Georgetown you can take a local bus (about 1usd) and get out right before the river and then walk 10 to 15 min.

Waiting time: 0 minutes. First car stop to Kualal Lumpur! :) Awesome ride!

July 2015
Cheers! //Yriy

Hitchhiked fast right to Sungai Petani!

July 2015
Cheers! //Yriy
From Border THai-Malay will go Malaysia part was so easy. Just walk bit from out border gate. All car go to next city for sure, Alor Setar. If lucky you can get ride until Kuala Lumpur, Penang.
Very good spot. Few meters after the junction. Good visibility. You can easily find a lift to Singapore or to Kuala Lumpur,
~200m after the mosque. It's good place for HH, with good visibility. Very easy to catch a direct lift to KL. Or step by step to Melaka and other destinations.
You have to walk few minutes away the town. You can easily get a free lift to the junction roads 64 and 98 (going to KL, Melaka, Singapore)
Going out of Tanah Rata town; on the left hand side, under high rocks. Very good spot for HH to Kuala Lumpur. I was waiting less than 3 min for direct lift.

HH from Bon Ton Resort. Very easy and fast. Working even after sunset.
The whole Langkawi Island is very easy and nice place for HH.
Easy to hitchhike in and out of Georgetown
Lift to Kundasang, busy route
lift to polumpung, nice people here
Easy ride to KK in the end of afternoon
really great spot
We've got the lift to the border even though the guy wasn't going there.
We were just walking ahead, two guys stopped and asked where are we going. We drove with them 300 km. They also invited us for the dinner

We stood about 3 minutes on the bus stop, the first car wanted the money but suddenly a queue of cars started to make because everyone wanted to helped us ðŸ˜‚ the next guy who took us went with us to the next town, invited us for dinner, showed us around his city and took us to the park. Then dropped at the hotel
Great place for a hop, skip and a jump into town. Good local traffic going to the center
Super good spot. Tree for shade, cars moving slow as they rejoin before going to the highway, had a Melaka sign and got a truck in less than a minute (4th vehicle)

Really good spot as the road coming out of the border checkpoint is a bit dodgy so people have to slow down. Space for them to stop in the taxi rank. Most trucks will turn left to the industrial estate at the first intersection so go for cars. Was here late in the evening but donâ€™t think there would be shade.
I got unlucky I think as there wasnâ€™t much traffic. Be careful and donâ€™t get stuck as the border shuts from 11pm to 5am (Thai time)
Great spot just after the skudai toll plaza, good visibility on just after the rest area. Had plenty of drivers stop and managed to get a truck to melaka within 10 minutes
Great place to hitchhike if you want to get to Penang or Kl. I would recommend you to use signs to get to Penang, or Ipoh then Kl.

The toll gate area was busy, so we went up to the highway. Usually, the turn area has a good room for drivers to break. This particular turn has not so much room, but we even managed to stop a big truck to Johor in just 2 minutes.
Waited 15min to find a lift which took me half the way to Ipoh. Just after the pedestrian bridge

If you want to go towards Butterworth/ over the bridge you ust wait back here as the cars will be merging into the far right lane. Nevertheless I found a ride within about 15 mins when standing by the bus stop.

If you take the bus over to Malaysia from Singapore you can walk east out of the Bus Station and find the road that leads to the freeway towards KL.  I have hitched here twice in recent years and both times i got a lift very fast - like most places in Malaysia ;)
Hitch spot on the freeway entrance ramp.

It is a good place to reach south toll gates. Cars drives quite slow and they have a lot of space to stop. There was a little renovation there so it can a bit change. From toll gates you can easily have a ride to Melaka or Singapore.

Using bus 400 you can get off on leisure mall or one bus stop earlier (should be even better).

Hi there!

Could you please give more detailed info of where the bus stop is to hitchhike north from KL?

Thank you!
Kuala Lumpur is very easy city to hitchhike in, there is not so many spots where people can pull over but you can use the bus stops in the city.
surprisingly busy, ride back to Kuantan in half an hour
Easy lift to Fairy cave by local people
Did this ride twice and once, a national park ranger took me inside the National park without paying the RM 50 entrance fee. Thanks :)
Good place to hitchhike south, at least short distances. Cars go very slowly in the heavy traffic and there's some shelter under the bus stop.

Was super late at night and was walking to camp but a car saw me and took me to KL. Pretty sure there is a solid spot for hitching where the service road meets the petrol outlet before the highway. (Marker) not sure about shade.
Was picked up after 40 minutes. Multiple cars stopped, some wanted money. Met lovely people there.
Was able to stop a car here as I walked out of KK head for Mount Kinabula
Place for heading south, plenty of room for people to stop and an easy walk out of KK.
Very poor traffic. But HH is possible, even to the gates of Taman Negara National Park.
Traffic is very poor, but it's still possible to HH back from Taman Negara to Jerantut.
Some taxis drivers are nice enough to lift you up free
Easy lift up the road
Lift to the main road
We just stand on the road and stick out the thumb. After 15 minutes to ladies took us. They invited us to Thier house and to stay for night.

Behind the caltex gas station is the art castle! A place for travellers and hitchhikers to stay, create art and meet other travellers and the lovely local people supporting the castle! Drop by if you have a chance, i definitely recommend it! ^^
Mostly local traffic or drivers offering giving a lift to the bus station. Hard but not impossible to HH.

Not the best spot for HH. Mostly local traffic. Most drivers stops b'cos of the shopping mall, those who want to help are offering lift to the bus station. It took me >half an hour to stop a car which took me to the toll gates.
Just one road on this island, and everyone will try to be a taxi, offering a ride for an unfairly high price.
